CustomField.description: Property is capitalized as a fixed asset when the economic life is more than one year, the property is acquired for continuous business operations, and the gross cost is $5,000 or more. Group asset purchases, each having an original cost less than the minimum dollar capitalization limit, will be capitalized when: - Similar items are purchased as a group, and the total purchase is greater than $10,000 - Each separate unit has an original cost of $2,000 or more - The economic life is greater than one year and the property is acquired for continuous business use All 3 above criteria must be met.
CustomField.label: Investment Detail Criteria
